meanings.definition: To break down food in the stomach for absorption into the bloodstream.
meanings.sent1: After I eat, my body works to digest the food.
meanings.sent2: It takes time for the stomach to digest a heavy meal.
meanings.sent3: I joked that my stomach must be a superhero to digest all that food.
meanings.sent4: Her mind seemed to digest the information slowly, like a computer processing data.
meanings.sent5: The enzymes in the stomach help to digest the food efficiently.

meanings.definition: A compilation or summary of information.
meanings.sent1: The teacher asked us to read the digest of the novel.
meanings.sent2: I enjoy reading the daily news digest to stay informed.
meanings.sent3: The digest of the report made studying for the exam easier.
meanings.sent4: The digest of the meeting highlighted the key points discussed.
meanings.sent5: The digest provided a concise overview of the research findings.

meanings.sent1: It can be challenging to digest complex concepts quickly.
meanings.sent2: She needed time to digest the news of her promotion.
meanings.sent3: I tried to digest the instructions, but they were confusing.
meanings.sent4: His mind struggled to digest the implications of the decision.
meanings.sent5: The students took a moment to digest the new information before asking questions.

meanings.definition: A periodical publication containing articles on a specific topic.
meanings.sent1: I always look forward to the latest science digest.
meanings.sent2: The fashion digest features trends from around the world.
meanings.sent3: The travel digest inspired me to plan my next vacation.
meanings.sent4: The health digest provided valuable tips for staying fit.
meanings.sent5: The technology digest covers the latest gadgets and innovations.
